intro: Galium bungei var. trachyspermum, commonly known as rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in fine, rough hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
